intro: Pseudoconnarus rhynchosioides, commonly known as the slender spike moss, is a rare and specialized plant belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its delicate, needle-like leaves and a short, compact stem. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, including microsporangia and megasporangia, are located on the upper surface of the sporophylls. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
